Driving off the pavement was something Tucson was most known for.  Even his=
 style of fighting reflects strongly on his beliefs that sometimes you have=
 to think outside the box to get the job done. 

He raises a brow of concen=
tration as he listens for the faintest sounds coming from Nightstrike and L=
amia within the room.  He picks up on foot steps, even the most softest of =
steps.  His audio sensors become his visuals, as he processes the informati=
on and moves according to the patterns of the sounds.  Darkenss being the n=
orm of his every day life, Tucson was neither bothered or upset by it.  Ind=
eed if there was fun to be had, he was having a good time right now, doing =
the job that Autobots were most famous for.

" Hah, playing dirty..  That's=
 just putting it mildly."  

He could hear that Nightstrike had gotten hims=
elf a weapon once more, just by the tiny sounds that fingers make when they=
 click against the holster of their weapons or the clicks of weapons themse=
lves as they are prepared for combat.  At the same time, with incredible sw=
iftness, he loads up another six arrows in the cross bow.  With a casual ga=
te, he walks into the next room, yet, being highly attentive to the sounds =
around him.  At the same time, his sonar systems were now coming up with po=
sitive visuals of who was inside.  They translate the waves to heat reading=
s thus turning them into thermal images, which his systems quickly find mat=
ches for.  He sends a com message back to Lord Perseus.

" I have a positiv=
e ID on the Hostiles in question.  First one detected, is identified as Nig=
htstrike, who is apparently as adept in darkness as I am.  Second hostile d=
etected, is Lamia, not sure on their characteristics but I do have them as =
being hostile.  Again these identifications are coming in through sonar and=
 thermal reading systems, and they're known to be faulty.  I'm sending thes=
e to you for confirmation of my findings.  Normally I'm quite sure of thing=
s but there are alot more signals flooding my sonars than I can keep up wit=
h, these two just happened to be the two I zeroed in most of all."

His tra=
nsmission is swift, and soon delivers the data to Perseus. As soon as he tr=
ansmits, he returns to focusing on the job at hand.  Stopping Nightstrike a=
nd Lamia.  

" Old junk..  Good one.  You won't be saying that in a few ast=
ro seconds that's for sure."  

Tucson grows tired of the charades that Nig=
htstrike was playing.  It was time to skunk him out completely.  He moves  =
into the same room as Nightstrike and Lamia, and uses his sonar equipment t=
o scan the schematics of the room.  He finds just what he's looking for and=
 slams a palm on the side of a revolving door, which now slams shut, includ=
ing others leading into and out of the room, isolating himself with Nighstr=
ike and Lamia.

" Let's hear you call me old junk now Nightstrike.  Oh yeah=
, I know who you are...  I forgot to mention that my sonar systems double a=
s an identication module.. And Lamia, I know you're in here somewhere too..=
 "

Even though he had pinpointed them, Tucson fires no weapons and makes n=
o moves to do any harm.  As an Autobot he swore not to harm anyone unless t=
hey harmed him first.  He keeps the doors shut and continues the period of =
isolation until at least one of them came out into the open.  Not letting h=
is guard down for one moment, he continues to scan the room with sonar equi=
pment and remains ready for anything.
